description: The Stan Malay is a Marine warship stationed at the G-8 base. The vessel was heavily damaged in a storm prior to the events of episode 204, with significant structural damage and many crew members injured and recovering in the infirmary.

keyMoments.description: Inspector Shepherd recklessly orders the damaged Stan Malay to be readied for pursuit of the Straw Hats, despite the ship not being seaworthy and half the crew still injured
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Shepherd's incompetence and disregard for his troops' safety, contrasting with Jonathan's careful leadership

description: A Skypiean vehicle that Nami acquired during the Sky Island adventure. It is a water-based vehicle powered by Breath Dials that allows for high-speed travel across water. The waver was confiscated by the Marines when the Going Merry landed at G-8.

keyMoments.description: Nami and Sanji are assigned to retrieve the confiscated waver as part of Usopp's two-team strategy
keyMoments.significance: One of the two primary mission objectives for the Straw Hats in this episode

description: The massive amount of gold that the Straw Hats obtained from Skypiea, taken from the ruins of Shandora. This gold represents significant wealth and was confiscated by the Marines when the crew landed at G-8.

keyMoments.description: The gold is the target of the retrieval team led by Usopp, with Luffy, Zoro, and Robin
keyMoments.significance: Primary objective that drives the main plot of the episode

keyMoments.description: Jonathan reveals he moved the gold to his personal quarters, leaving the vault empty
keyMoments.significance: Shows Jonathan's tactical planning and outsmarting of the Straw Hats
